term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - dust in atmospheric chemistry
term.title: dust

item.text: Small, dry, solid particles projected into the air by natural forces, such as wind, volcanic eruption and by mechanical or manmade processes such as crushing, grinding, milling, drilling, demolition, shoveling, conveying, screening, bagging and sweeping. Dust particles are usually in the size range from about 1-100 µm - in diameter and they settle slowly under the influence of gravity.
